job_description:
About WELL

WELL is an innovative technology enabled healthcare company whose overarching objective is to positively impact health outcomes by leveraging technology to empower and support healthcare practitioners and their patients.

WELL’s practitioner enablement platform includes comprehensive end to end practice management tools inclusive of virtual care and digital patient engagement capabilities as well as Electronic Medical Records (EMR), Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) and data protection services. WELL uses this platform to power healthcare practitioners both inside and outside of WELL’s own omni-channel patient services offerings.

WELL owns and operates Canada's largest network of outpatient medical clinics serving primary and specialized healthcare services and is the provider of a leading multi-national multi-disciplinary telehealth offering. WELL is publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol "WELL". To learn more about the company, please visit: www.well.company .

About The Team

The WELL EMR Group is responsible for the development and support of the OSCAR platform, a leading Electronic Medical Record (EMR) software in Canada that supports thousands of providers and millions of Canada patients across the country. Primarily located in the greater Toronto area and the greater Vancouver area, the team currently works remotely due to COVID with expectations to remain remote for the near future. We are a remote first with hybrid support where desired.

About The Position

Reporting to the Director of Development, the Technical Lead plays a critical role in guiding and informing all technical aspects of the OSCAR product roadmap. The Technical Lead is responsible for planning, architecting, estimating and managing the delivery of large projects in the OSCAR PRO and JUNO products. As the Technical Lead, you will be called upon to have a wide view of all technical work that the OSCAR team is performing, ensuring that key technical designs and decisions and aligned to long term goals.

You will be responsible for providing technical support to the rest of the team and will be a key enabler, ensuring that constant progress on the projects you oversee is obtained. Where technical coaching and guidance is required by the team, you will play an active role in helping to support the team’s growth and development.

Mission

Deliver high quality software through technical leadership on the JUNO OSCAR EMR Group. Produce predictable, confident and professional results.

Outcomes

As the technical lead on the JUNO team, you are responsible for developing features and functionality for the JUNO and OSCAR Pro EMR systems.

Complete PrescribeIT Integration Certification For JUNO EMR

Complete PrescribeIT conformance testing for the JUNO EMR.

Improve Testing Practices

Continue to support the JUNO EMR testing practices including expanding unit testing practices, test data management, API testing and other best practices.

Deliver Well Architected Software

Develop high level architecture designs that communicate intent and are appropriate for their goals. Minimizes complexity but seeks to ensure complete and well architected solutions.

Provide Technical Leadership

Provide technical leadership through adoption of best practices. Constantly scanning the environment for better methods and technologies. Adopt and leads transformation as a team where needed. Ensure the team is actioning on the right priorities and intercept where priorities are questioned and validate when they need to change.

Competencies

Technical. Passionate about crafting software. Produces code that flows from the fingertips naturally.

Honest. Honest with an ability to speak truthfully in all scenarios and with all stakeholders to properly represent their position and customer’s interests.

Smart. The role requires individuals that have a generally high level of intelligence and a mental toughness for solving problems.

Communicator. Able to communicate clearly in a structured and thoughtful fashion. Provides context (background) and clarity (details) as required and appropriately. Direct.

Leadership. Aligns the team around solutions. Ensures concerns are discussed. Motivates to the mission.

About You

You have a deep understanding of Java, JavaScript, MySQL, Tomcat, Linux, git and tools such as JIRA and Bitbucket. You are comfortable documenting architecture and software from the micro to macro scale and can easily communicate at different levels as required by stakeholders. You are able to easily translate large challenges into smaller, actionable tasks and execute on them with ease.

You understand the value of automated tests, DevOps, agile practices and methodologies and deliver full value to your projects.

The Successful Candidate Will Also

Possess 7 years of software development experience with appropriate supporting education.
Take pride in delivering great products to our customers.
Possess strong communication skills and communicate with precision and clarity.
Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and prioritize your time and focus effectively.
Have exacting standards and a deep understanding of best practices and industry standards.
Monitor and course correct software developers and teams as needed.
Lead by example and actively contribute to the day to day work
Be confident in making decisions and helping prioritize work for their team.
